column4: What does the grub option "rescue mode" do, aside from logging me in as root?
does that mean the disks are mounted at that point?
if they dont depend on network or raid or something
I am asking because I want to run a fsck, for which the disks are not supposed to be mounted. I can do it booting in liveCD..
you can only do it using a bootcd or another installation
for some fscks its enough to mount ro
you can try using mount / -o ro,remount to do that
but it fails most of the time
Well thanks for the tips.. I think I can use a LiveCD.. and preferrably a smaller live CD than the Ubuntu one, since I want to only bootin command line mode
thanks.. though I doubt my hard disk is bad.. It automatically fscks every 30 times anyway.
if you think its physically damaged do a badblocks on its device
I doubt that. amphi: yeah, I am going to use the SysRescueCD anyway. It has something called partimage which might come in handy for me :)
